protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* The ability to give fully informed consent
* Male or female aged â‰¥ 18 years of age.
* Admission with a suspected acute asthma attack.
* Able (in the investigator's opinion) and willing to comply with clinical investigation requirements.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Other clinically significant respiratory diseases including predominant Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and bronchiectasis.
* Any other clinically significant medical disease or uncontrolled concomitant disease that is likely, in the investigator's opinion, to impact the ability to participate in the study or the study results.
* Pregnant women, lactating women or women who are planning to become pregnant.
* Investigator determined apparent other cause for admission.
* Acute COVID infection.
* Non-English-speaking participants who are unable to comprehend the reasons for the study due to limitations in understanding the English language

primary.measure: Assessment of cytokine levels in nasal lining fluid at attack and recovery visits
primary.description: Nasal absorption will be used to collect mucosal lining fluid from the respiratory tract for cytokines profiling at baseline (attack) and at second visits.

primary.measure: The measurement of vitamin D levels in the blood on admission to the hospital
primary.description: vitamin D levels in the blood on admission to the hospital

primary.measure: Assessment of evidence of infection: sputum for bacterial culture and sensitivity (MC&S).
primary.description: Assessment of evidence of infection: sputum for bacterial culture and sensitivity (MC\&S).

primary.measure: Assessment of evidence of infection: CRP.
primary.description: Assessment of evidence of infection: CRP.

primary.measure: Assessment of evidence of infection: Throat swab/nasal lavage for viral PCR.
primary.description: Assessment of evidence of infection: Throat swab/nasal lavage for viral PCR.

primary.measure: A specific asthma history (polypharmacy, previous asthma attacks, triggers, Personalised Asthma Action Plan) for the assessment of risk factor for attack.
primary.description: Assessment of risk factor for attack

primary.measure: Assessment of adherence to medications (MARS, prescription records, inhaler technique) for the assessment of behavioural attack traits.
primary.description: Assessment of behavioural attack traits.

primary.measure: Assessment of airway obstruction at attack and recovery visits using peak expiratory flow rate (PEFR).
primary.description: Assessment of airway obstruction

primary.measure: Assessment of airway obstruction at attack and recovery visits using spirometry.
primary.description: Assessment of airway obstruction

primary.measure: Assessment of airway obstruction at attack and recovery visits using Forced Oscillation Technique (FOT).
primary.description: Assessment of airway obstruction

primary.measure: Assessment of airway obstruction at attack using physician recorded expiratory wheeze
primary.description: Assessment of airway obstruction

primary.measure: Assessment of airway inflammation at attack and recovery visits using Fractional Exhaled Nitric Oxide (FeNO).
primary.description: Assessment of airway inflammation

primary.measure: Assessment of airway inflammation at attack and recovery visits using sputum inflammatory cell count.
primary.description: Assessment of airway inflammation

primary.measure: Assessment of airway inflammation at attack and recovery visits using blood eosinophil count.
primary.description: Assessment of airway inflammation

primary.measure: Assessment of symptom burden at attack and recovery visits using the Acute AQLQ questionnaire
primary.description: Assessment of symptom burden

primary.measure: Assessment of Body Mass Index BMI.
primary.description: Assessment of Body Mass Index BMI.

primary.measure: Assessment of the incidence of upper airway symptoms.
primary.description: The incidence of upper airway symptoms will be assessed using the Sino-nasal Outcome Test (SNOT).

primary.measure: The assessment of the incidence of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.
primary.description: The assessment of the incidence of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease using the GERDQ questionnaire.

primary.measure: The assessment of the incidence of vocal cord dysfunction
primary.description: The assessment of the incidence of vocal cord dysfunction using the Pittsburgh Vocal Cord Dysfunction (VCD) Index.

primary.measure: The assessment of the incidence of dysfunctional breathing
primary.description: The assessment of the incidence of dysfunctional breathing using the Nijmegen dysfunctional questionnaire.

primary.measure: The assessment of the incidence of anxiety and depression
primary.description: The assessment of the incidence of anxiety and depression using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
